byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Riga, Latvia, and Vilnius, Lithuania, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and STEVEN LEE MYERS

abstract: Pentagon, seeking to deter potential Russian aggression in Europe, proposes first major expansion of troops and heavy weaponry in Eastern Europe since end of Cold War; are proposing to deliver battle tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and as many as 5,000 American troops to NATO member nations in region; plan, if approved, would signal major shift in policy and send clear message of resolve to allies and Russia.
lead_paragraph: The proposal, if approved, would represent the first time since the end of the Cold War that the United States has stationed heavy military equipment in Eastern Europe.

headline.main: U.S. Is Poised to Put Heavy Weaponry in Eastern Europe
headline.print_headline: U.S. Poised to Put Heavy Weaponry in East Europe

snippet: The proposal, if approved, would represent the first time since the end of the Cold War that the United States has stationed heavy military equipment in Eastern Europe.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
